issue.title: allow failures for 2.2 and keep testing on 2.1 until 2.2 tests are passing

repository.name: activeadmin
repository.description: The administration framework for Ruby on Rails applications.

body: Rails core still sounds like this might end up being resolved if someone steps up, so we should leave this open to track the issue to resolution.

The issue rails/rails#18160 is closed
But there is a new PR rails/rails#18306

issue.title: undefined method `reorder' for nil:NilClass

repository.name: activeadmin
repository.description: The administration framework for Ruby on Rails applications.

issue.body:
```
/Users/ain/.rvm/gems/ruby-2.2.0/gems/activeadmin-0.6.3/app/views/active_admin/resource/index.html.arb where line #2 raised:

undefined method `reorder' for nil:NilClass
```

Request:

```
{"order"=>"updated_at_desc"}
```

The code:

``` ruby
config.sort_order = "updated_at_desc"
```

Full stack:

body: I'd say that, if it doesn't require a lot of work, it is safe to maintain. When I said any new releases, I mean normal releases. Severe security releases will still be done until Rails 5 is released. They just doesn't happen often. The last release was November 16, 2014 and I'm not sure when will be the next one. But the stable branch is stable and should not change, so it still works.

@rafaelfranca sorry for not posting the full quote (Updated to the full text)

But the question is still the same...

Looks like they've merged the 3.2/2.2 patches into the 3-2-stable branch and closed rails/rails#18160. If a future 3.2.22 is released (for security) it will contain these patches (if I understand the comment thread correctly).

Any general ideas what causes the incompatibility with 3.2/2.2 for AA? I ran into the issue mentioned in #3733. [edit: PR below]
I've fixed the Ruby 2.2 & Rails 3.2 compatibility issue for the 0-6-stable branch in PR #3760. I suspect the change is also relevant to master, so you may want to review and merge it there as well.

issue.title: run Travis against Rails 3.2 and Ruby 2

repository.name: activeadmin
repository.description: The administration framework for Ruby on Rails applications.

issue.body:
closes #3715

Rails 3.2.22 includes the Ruby 2 fixes. The test suite passed for me locally. I'm only opening a PR to see if JRuby also passes by having Travis run it, because I'm too impatient to install JRuby.
